statement.p: I saw a job opening for a Translator that pays \displaystyle\${59},{000} per year salary. Assume that a regular work week for this job is \displaystyle{30} hours, and that you will work \displaystyle{48} weeks in a year.
What is the hourly pay for this job? We will answer the question by converting 59,000 per year into dollars per hour.

If we begin with the fraction \displaystyle\frac{{\${59000}}}{\text{year}}, we can multiply by two unit fractions to complete the conversion. What are these fractions? Choose the correct fractions in the calculation below:
Finally, what is the hourly pay for this job?

myopenmath.solution:
A: 1 year/48 weeks
D: 1 week/30 hours
40.97
For this job, we know the following conversion facts:
1 year = 59000 dollars
1 year = 48 weeks
1 week = 30 hours
So, we can convert the yearly rate of 59,000 per year into dollars per hour by the following calculation:
\displaystyle\frac{{\${59000}}}{{\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{red}\cancel{{\text{year}}}}}}{{{48}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{weeks}}}}}}\cdot\frac{{{1}\ {\color{blue}\cancel{{\text{week}}}}}}{{{30}\ \text{hours}}}=\frac{{\${59000}\cdot{1}\cdot{1}}}{{{1}\cdot{48}\cdot{30}\ \text{hours}}}
\displaystyle\approx\frac{\text{\$}}{\text{hour}}
So, the position pays dollars/hour.
